argument.name: character
argument.description: A variable containing a date value or a character string containing a legitimate representation of a date value ( < span class=Code1>ISDATE (Date_Representation) = .T. ).

page.description: Converts a character string to a date value.
page.discussion: CTOD() returns a Date value extracted from a character string. For more information about date formats, see the DATE_FORMAT()function. The two most frequent uses of CTOD() are: searching and filtering date fields, and converting character fields containing dates into real date fields. Note : If the setting for Fully Specified Years requires all dates to be fully specified CTOD returns a blank value for years specified as 2 numbers.

section.description: Assume that you just re-configured an existing table to add a new date field called START_DATE. CTOD converts the character date string to a date field type so that you can insert it into START_DATE. Note : A convenient alternative to CTOD() is enclosing the date values (without quotation marks) in curly brackets (e.g., {12/12/95}).
